issue.title: val can't move joints after a fall

content.raw:
As far as I can tell, the only way of handling ihmc errors is to see if ROS_ERROR or ROS_WARNING was published (and what its content was) within a certain time frame before a fall. 

As for falls caused by Gazebo, I don't know how you would automate detecting that. So that may be just not even possible to deal with.

This particular issue is meant to address falls caused by operator and controller limitations, and assuming that the robot is on the ground and the controllers are still running, why ihmc high level controllers won't let us communicate with robot joints. 

If we are unaware of an existing method for this purpose, what is the correct approach for moving robot's joints while it is on the ground?
